reviewText: I love these walking workouts! I have the 1 and 2 mile and the 3 and 4 mile.  Right now I'm using this one (1 and 2) as one of my prenatal workouts.  The two mile is absolutely perfect! I have my OB's consent to do this, it is perfectly safe just monitor yourself and slow down if needed.  I've been working out for a long time so I haven't needed any adjustments. This workout helps me feel great, I don't have the aches and pains I did with my last pregnancy. It feels so good to be able to continue my activity!Before I was pregnant, I used this DVD as an add on.  I'd do the one or two mile and then lift weights or do yoga for 30-40 mins.This is a great workout for beginners, intermediates and advanced exercisers.  If you are a beginner, this is an easy way to get started.  Intermediates and advanced, it's a fabuloous add on to whatever you are doing.  It's a great way to mix things up and add in something different.  Or, just something easy for an "off day".  I've been pleasantly surprised at how effective this can be!

reviewText: Leslie gives good cueing, and the workouts are very easy to follow! Walking is my best new exercise-right in my own home!! Very easy, but somewhat challanging! Excellent workout! Grade A!!!

reviewText: I bought this video last summer. I did the 20 minute workout at least 5x a week for two or three weeks and lost 5 lbs. while dieting. The problem is I have a daughter who was 6 months at the time who started cutting her naps too short for me to finish the video.Anyways, the workout is great. You might not feel like you're doing much work the first time, but the second day you really feel it.My only complaint is that if you are extremelly uncordinated (like me) it will take you a few times to get the routine down.

reviewText: Years ago I had a Leslie Sansone exercise video. She must have been 12 years old. Maybe not, but when I found out she made 'walking' DVDs, I just had to have one, even though I'm not into walking and never wanted to be a walker.I do have a treadmill and an elliptical machine. I watched the Leslie Sansone DVD while on my exercise equipment, so I didn't do anything but walk. I don't enjoy high-impact exercise, so just the walking was enough for me.I never expected to make it up to 1 mile, much less 2. Then I ordered the 3-mile walk DVD.These are an excellent way to enjoy getting fit. I recommend them highly! I recommend Leslie Sansone highly!Edited 3-4-12 to say that 5 miles is not a problem for me now. I'm convinced that consistency, working at it every day, is the key to building strength and endurance. Leslie Sansone's walking videos are a good way to make that happen.
summary: Walking Has Never Been More Fun!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Leslie Sansone won herself a whole new audience with the Walk Away the Pounds DVDs. These workouts are a wonderful way to get fit for people of all ages and fitness levels. This DVD features the 1-mile walk and the 2-mile walk. This DVD is the perfect introduction to Leslie's walking workouts.The moves are very simple:- knee lifts- kick backs- side steps- kicks- and of course, walkingThe 1-mile walk runs 20 minutes. The 2-mile walk runs 31 minutes. If you're just getting started, these workouts will fit into anyone's schedule!Once you've mastered the basic steps, she helps to create more intensity by stepping out further, squatting into the moves, and using light weights. While she promotes the "Walk Away Weights" in the DVD, light hand weights (2 - 3 pounds) can be substituted, just be sure to watch your form.A helpful meter appears along the way, to show you just far you've walked. Leslie's warm demeanor and encouragement really keep you motivated to make it to that 1 mile or 2 mile marker. The other outstanding motivator in these workouts is her walking group: real people! Deb is in her 50's, Randy is an older man, a new mother, and women in their 20's and 30's round out the walkers.The workout can be customized to fit your lifestyle, and that is one of it's greatest features. When you're looking to work harder, squat down, push yourself, and use the weights. On days that you're just not feeling 100%, skip the weights and still get a great cardio workout.If you enjoy working out at home, this is a must-have workout. Thank you Leslie!
summary: Great Workout For Getting Started With Fitness
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD contains two full workouts...a 20 minute "1 mile walk" and 30 minute "2 mile walk."  The 20 minute walk is a good place to start for absolute beginners.  It gently gets you moving with simple movements such as marching in place, side steps, knee lifts, kicks, and kick backs.  The 30 minute workout uses these same movements but is longer and has a slightly faster pace. Both workouts use Leslie's "weighted balls."  These are just round 2lb weights.  I'd recommend going to the store and buying some 2lb dumbbells or wrist straps instead as they are probably cheaper.  Personally I use 2lb dumbbells.  You don't need to use any weights though, and one person in Leslie's crew demonstrates the arm movements with no weights.  Another person demonstrates with the weights, but does easier movements.  So if her way is too difficult, there are two other options.After doing the two mile workout 3 times a week for several weeks, I found my enthusiasm begin to drop for two reasons.  First, the moves are very very repetitive.  It's great to only be doing five steps for people who have just started.  But after awhile it gets old.Second, Leslie and her friends spend a great deal of time bragging about how great the workout is.  After the 10th time you've watched the video, this banter becomes annoying.  She also spends nearly five minutes straight trying to sell you the weighted balls, talking about how they are the best weights ever.  They are 2lb weights, just like any other 2lb weight.  I think this DVD would be better if you could turn the talking off and just listen to the music.  Yes, I know I could mute my tv and turn on the radio, but I would like to have a music that is going at the same rhythm as theirs so I can keep count.Anyway, I have recently discovered Leslie's Walkerobics 2 mile walk.  It's part of an older set.  It's about the same length as this 2 mile walk, but more intense with more variation in the moves.  It's a bigger challenge that I enjoy, but I'm glad I started with this set to begin with.

reviewText: Listen to what the reviewers say...this really is wonderful for beginners to fitness,and for all ages and sizes.  It's not "hard" vis a vis the moves (can't imagine anything easier) but you WILL work up a sweat and your heart will beat if you are new to fitness. If you do it over and over, it will get boring, like anything. But I rotate it in and out of my DVD workouts and it ROCKS, esp. if you are short on time but want to do SOMETHING.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I give Leslie Sansone credit.  She has made a bundle out of teaching people how to walk in place.  But you know what?  It works.What I like about this CD is that it is easy for us older folks to do. Most exercise tapes are marketed towards a 20 something crowd and its hard to find something for us "mature" exerciser to do.Most of her tapes have 4 basic steps so there is no tough choreography that one has to master.  Most of her tapes can be modified so that you can do it at your own speed.  You can do this inside, regardless of what the weather is like outside.  Very little chance of "overdoing it". There is no head banging music.  Finally, Lesllie seems very personable.My doctor says that dollar for dollar, walking is one of your best exercise routines and although I do add some light weight training and easy stretching, the Walk Away the Pounds tapes, helps keep me in pretty good shape.

reviewText: I especially like this DVD because it is so lively and includes more input from the other people in it.  Thank you Leslie for putting out these DVD's/tapes because I have used them for years and feel I am much more healthy (at age 73) than I would have been without them.

reviewText: The Leslie Sansone DVD to help me get in shape arrived before schedule, so emotionally I was not ready to start the exercise program. I had to really psych myself up this morning to put the DVD in my recently purchased from Amazon Panasonic player - by the way, 5 Stars there too - and listened to the instructions. All I could think of was the sound of Leslie Sansone's voice and thought this was not going to kill me! At 73 years old and without previous exercise, I am going to take this one slowly or I will end up lame for a long time. I do think in time that I will get it and be able to be more flexible than I am now without causing damage to my entire body. I'm really glad I got this since it is to hot to walk outside, there are no gyms in the area and I can do this at home without anyone laughing at me!
summary: The First Thing I Had To Learn How To Do Is "Get Up and Get Started!"

reviewText: To start an exercise program, this is a great starter one just to get you going. You will want to move on to more challenging ones soon, though

reviewText: For beginners starting out who want to increase their fitness level without injuries, these workouts are perfect! Start with the 1 mile workout, and work up to the 2 mile workout's faster pace. Leslie Sansone also has 3 and 4 mile workouts that continue the progressive increase in fitness. The workouts are low impact and you don't need a lot of room. The movements are easy -- no complicated dance movements or high impact jumping. The one part I didn't like is the music is boring elevator type music, and Leslie does talk a lot. Not as much (or as cutesie annoying as Denise Austin), but she does get a bit perky. :) I used to play a CD of other music while I did the workout to make it more my style.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have all the grace of a bull in a china shop and have spent most of my life avoiding physical activity like the plague.  However, having reached the milestone of my 40th birthday, and having recently come out the winner in a battle with breast cancer, I am now attempting to build up my stamina and endurance, as well as take better care of body.  I never imagined that I would ever think of exercise as fun, but I really do enjoy these Leslie Sansone Walk Away the Pounds workouts.  I started by using the 1 mile "Get Up and Get Started" and have worked my way up to the 2 mile "High Calorie Burn" every morning, occasionally tacking the 1 mile on again in the afternoon for a little "boost".  I may not be coordinated enough to walk and chew gum, but I can "Walk Away the Pounds" and so can you!
summary: Great for those of us who are "coordination impaired"

reviewText: First of all, I love Leslie Sansone.  That being said, I orginally bought her VCR tape many years ago and it finally went bad.  So I bought the DVD and just love it.  I highly recommend her workouts.  I also recommend her Walk With The Family DVD.  That's a high energy workout with Walk Away the Pounds.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I, too, have Fibromyalgia.  My rheumatologist ordered me to exercise because I also have some significant bone loss for someone my age (55).  I've never been self-disciplined enough to exercise on a regular basis, but since I could do this in the privacy of my home and at times that were convenient for me, I ordered the DVD.  It is the perfect workout to "Get Up and Get Started" as the title says.  I do it in the mornings before showering and getting ready for work.  I started with the 1-mile and have now worked up to the 2-mile.  It is quite a workout, but it's perfect for anyone who's like me and really out of shape.  I already feel so much better.  Doing the exercises has boosted my energy level and made me more mentally alert, helping overcome the mental fog that is one of the symptoms of Fibromyalgia.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who wishes to begin an exercise regimen, or to anyone who needs a short, low-impact regimen from time to time due to time constraints.  I plan to order more of Leslie's workouts.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great workout for beginners. Leslie's cheerfulness & energy makes this workout very fun & enjoyable, two words you wouldn't associate with exercise.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was my first introduction into the Walk Away the Pounds series. I'm not obese, but I am relatively out of shape and was looking for some way to exercise that would be fun and physically challenging without facing the usual problems of coordination with workout videos. Leslie's videos are perfect. This DVD includes 2 workouts, an 18 minute 1 Mile and 30 minute 2 Mile. All of her workouts include the basic steps:-Walking-Side steps-Kicks-Knee liftsShe also does kickbacks in the 30 minute which are one of my favorite moves. The moves are basic so you can focus on challenging yourself and getting your heart rate up. The music isn't always the best, and while some have complained of her chatter I was surprised to find I enjoy it. She will talk to you the whole workout and often the friendly group of ladies who she is walking with in this videos will chime in. I love the way it does make it seem like something familiar and pleasant, rather than a more intimidating video instructor screaming at you to work harder. While you are walking you will also see a little graphic occasionally appear at the bottom to tell you how far in the "miles" you have gone.I started with the one mile for several weeks and then moved on to the two mile. Both were challenging the first time through, and the two mile uses her walk away weights, which are 2 lb weighted balls. You can do the workouts without the weights just as easily, and I sometimes use my 3 lb hand weights instead. I would recommend this DVD as a great way to get started with Leslie Sansone's videos, increase your fitness, and have a pleasant but challenging workout that you can look forward to and not feel like an idiot doing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This exercise is great for the heart, great for dexterity, and also for helping in a weight-loss program.  I am 74 years old, and my granddaughter (age 14) and I both work together "walking."  Leslie Sansone is a helpful leader.

reviewText: The 2 mile walk is good for a quick (35 min.) workout at home, but I wish she did more arm work and more with the weights.  She doesn't use the weights until very close to the end.  In her 3 mile walk, she starts uses the weights around the 1/2 way mark.  It's a much better workout if you have the time (about 50 min.).
Title: N/A

reviewText: Leslie's DVDs got me started into exercising on a regular basis. I have 5 of them: 1, 2 and 3 mile WATP, 2-mile walk and the 4 mile Super Challenge. They're very easy to follow and non-intimidating. I have moved on to harder routines like Jari Love's DVDs, Rebounding, Voight's, Tamilee's, Turbo Jam, Tae Bo, Core Rhythms, Yoga Booty Ballet, Core Secrets, Bento's, Ellen Barrett's, etc. BUT I reach for Leslie's routines when I just want something light or on recovery days-days that I can't push myself but still want something to wake me up or feel energized. In 2005, 8 days after my gall bladder surgery, I went back to working out with Leslie's 2-mile DVD. I highly recommend this for someone who'd like to start a healthier lifestyle or someone who'd like to be physically active but be gentle on the body. Leslie is a chatter but I don't find her annoying. For 7 yrs now, I exercise 1/2 hr-1 hr/day except Saturdays because that's my 'cleaning/running errands' day. I'm 43 yrs. old, work full-time, married and a mother of 2 teenage boys....so I'm busy but my mind is set to take care of myself first so I could take care of everybody else. I only skip exercising when I'm on vacation but other than that that's how I start my day. Goodluck!
summary: This is how I got started.....

reviewText: I have Fibromyalgia, and was looking for a low-impact exercise programme to follow that wouldn't require days to recover from. I've not really followed the 2-mile programme, but the 1-mile is short and relatively easy. There's not a ton of bouncing, unless you want to, and you can get as intense as you want. Also, those participating in the video demonstrate three different levels throughout, so you can follow which ever one is more comfortable. The set is also a great value, as you have two programmes for the cost of one.
summary: Great for people with limited physical ability.

reviewText: A routine that works for beginners and intermediates!  The moves are basic and low-impact.  You can do these in a small living room.  Leslie is encouraging and her cues are impeccable.  She sells "weighted balls" to use with these workouts, but you can use any hand weights or a soup can from  your pantry.  These short workouts get your heartreat up and you can challenge yourself by making the movements bigger.  This is a great workout if you are just starting to exercise.
summary: I can't say enough good things about this one...
